intro: Campylotropis alopochloa, commonly known as the small-headed milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of many leguminous species. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, and it is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Campylotropis alopochloa is a perennial herb that plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
